name: Litil Divil
description: Welcome to the Underworld, where you guide Mutt, the bad luck Litil Divil, through the Labyrinth of Chaos to retrieve the Mystical Pizza of Plenty. Our “hero” takes a fateful step through the Mortal Portal to prowl five hellish levels of treacherous tunnels with more than 50 raucous rooms of gameplay.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 1.8 GHz Processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card compatible with DirectX 7

reviews.review_text: A well made labyrinth game. I Remember seeing my neighbor playing this game in 1999 (Game was released 1993)! The game is a huge challenge. The entire game you will be running in this maze collecting utilities along the way and dodging traps. Objective to the game is to retrieve the Mystical Pizza of Plenty, but you must find out the riddles to all of the doors which makes this game hard. Each riddle will be fustrating and you will end up dieing and dieing but thats what makes the game challenging. Each room has a unique level/puzzle feel. Game can be beatin anywhere from 3 hours to 15hours.  Pros Challenging game More than 40 rooms when afk you day dream (funny) Animations are pretty good for its time   Cons Controls you must figure out yourself No controller support

It's just... bad. I grew up in the age of DOS games, and I wouldn't have played this as a child, either. After ragequitting twice, I discovered the following:  Direction controls: Arrow keys or 2,4,6,8 on the numeric keypad. Fire buttons: Z and X.  It fails to mention that you need to press the direction you want to attack, to attack, but with the poor controls aside, the playability is low. The labyrinth is hard to navigate and the visibility of traps is poor. There may be a lot of nostalgia for people with this game... but I'll never play it again.
Not bad... Awesome Old-School game :D  But when you play this game... it's really weird. 7.5/10!

Boo! This was a fav of mine back in the Amiga days so why release a classic in less than its original state? I can let the graphics not being updated but the controller support... well... It sucks. I think I saw mention from another reviewer on this issue. Sure I could use the keyboard but I want to use my controller just like I did when I played it all those years ago. The problem is I am running a Windows 7 system and whoever released this did so by using the floppy disc PC version released after the Amiga version and use DOSBOX emulator to try and pull this off with minimal effort on their part. I feel like the Amiga CD32 version had some issues but I played it pretty far using a controller. I then bought the PC version a few years later. Then this is released on Steam and by now everything must be working if not improved because decades have passed. Not. Would have loved to say thumbs up and worth the memory. Nice try. I just think its clear that the fans would be the first do come and check it out and... Well... It is what it is.
Plenty of old games are really good. But this one is just not worth it in my opinion. Got it free but don't feel like putting the effort to play it. It looks cute but no fun.   -0/10
